questions.text: Describe how to avoid the propeller(s) when approaching an aircraft.
Who is responsible for seat belt use in the aircraft?
options: Everyone on the plane, including the pilot

questions.text: From whom do you take directions in the event of an aircraft problem?
Why is it important to exit on "Go!" (or "Arch!")?
options: So the pilot knows when to adjust the plane's trim
To ensure you and your instructor(s) leave at the same time and at the right place over the ground
If you stay in the door too long, the door monster will get you

questions.text: Where does the wind come from initially upon exit from the aircraft?
Why do skydivers first learn to fall stable face to earth (think in terms of the equipment)?
options: It's the best position for deployment
You can't tell how high you are if you're back-to-earth
Sitflying is too advanced a technique for new skydivers

questions.text: What does a canopy do immediately following a turn?

options: 1: Wing level 2: Clear and open area 3: Into the wind 4: PLF
1: Into the wind 2: Clear and open area 3: Flare at least half way 4: PLF
1: Wing Level 2: Flare at least half way 3: Clear and open field 4: PLF
1: Wing level 2: Clear and open area 3: Flare at least half way 4: PLF

questions.text: What is the purpose of the landing flare?
options: To ensure the wing is level
To slow the canopy down before landing
To convert forward speed to lift

questions.text: Describe the procedure for a hard landing (parachute landing fall or PLF).
options: Feet and knees together, hands and arms in, roll on landing
Extend legs in front with knees bent and prepare to absorb the impact
Fall to your knees, avoid hitting your head by catching yourself with your elbows/hands
